column5: I'll likely do some shore fishing at the causeway on Lake Eugenia!

I'm heading to Haliburton tommorow as I did a lake in Bancroft last Friday so going to try a lake I have not fished since early July as I know the weeds have grown some there now so gonna give it a try !!!! Then I will see where to fish Saturday & Sunday based on temps & weed growth !!!!! Cheers & fish-on......

Pigeon visiting a friend that just bought a house on the lake.  Perhaps  a muskie or two.  From what I've seen on Google Maps it's a weed infested lake that's going to have a billion people on it..  Can't wait!  /sarcasm.

lol @ weed infested...aka the lake is weeds thats it.   personally heading to pointe au baril tomorrow, then boating down to parry sound harbour for the evening laker bite...sleeping in the boat overnight and rigging sunday morning before first light.

You believe everything you read on the internet?  Sure, it might be busy, but weed infested? Nope, not at all.  If you don't connect with a musky your doing something wrong on pigeon. So much structure, and lots of fish.  Where abouts on the lake will you be? Maybe I can help ya out a little.  S.

Elliot Lake Sat and Sunday  for Brookies, pike and bass.  Then to BOQ for Walleye for the rest of the week.  I hope the weather stabilizes. Most jealous of this   I'll be in Parent, QC. Looks like an amazing secluded area for fishing; alas I will not have my fishing gear or a license....there for work.
Game on!
Balsam for the week Saturday to Saturday with the family. Bringing the new boat and I see a lot of fishing and tubing in our future.
I snuck out for an evening troll on rice tonight after work. My GF and I put 5 eyes in the boat....tough night  S.

I hope my weekend doesn't continue as it started. Got to the trailer a little late this evening. Wolfed down the Mary Brown's, grabbed my 5 year old and musky rod and figured I'd get a couple hours in before dark. Got to our spot and just about to set up a troll and RRRRRRIIIIIINNNNNGGGGG!!!! oh yeah, I'm on call. Minor alarm, no prob, clear it over the phone, can wait a bit. Ten minutes later RRRRRIIIINNNNGGGGGG again. Major alarm this time. Back to the dock, in the car and sitting at work still.

I hope my weekend doesn't continue as it started. Got to the trailer a little late this evening. Wolfed down the Mary Brown's, grabbed my 5 year old and musky rod and figured I'd get a couple hours in before dark. Got to our spot and just about to set up a troll and RRRRRRIIIIIINNNNNGGGGG!!!! oh yeah, I'm on call. Minor alarm, no prob, clear it over the phone, can wait a bit. Ten minutes later RRRRRIIIINNNNGGGGGG again. Major alarm this time. Back to the dock, in the car and sitting at work still. I feel ya. I had a co-worker get in an accident a couple weeks ago since then I've been working 6 day weeks and still am until the 9th. On the bright side that means I the rest of the summer off.
Southern Georgian Bay this weekend and part of next week.  Hope to get a few salmon.
Maybe Port Bruce on Monday. Saturday into the early hours of Sunday is tied up with a reunion of old military buddies in London.
Time to try the big O again, and then some Eyes on E if the weather agrees. Getting home from  O may be a bit of a challenge with the skyway bridge out tho...... back roads I guess
I'm with you.  I don't fish weekends at all now. Last time I did the amount of boats at the launch blew my mind.

Anyone want to fish the csfl at scugog with me?  Misfish- we should really hunt for those simcoe smallies together in the fall! If i had a paycheque yet then sure! Good luck man!  I'm working part of my weekend then Sunday or Monday I think I'm doing some canoeing/canoe dragging in to some hard to access lakes around the kawarthas.
Lake Huron/St Marys river north channel at St Joeseph island...no size limits on walleyes and I got a 7 lber there 2 weeks ago
Erieau Sat, LSC for musky Sun Working Monday boooo...
Heading home to fish on the Larry. Most likely jigging my favourite spots for giant eyes but there's so much to offer, we might switch things up and fish for whatever... Just good to be out there!

Wow...Its hard to belive that we have this many differant productive lakes around us.  Things like this remind me of just how fortunate to live where we do!  I half expected that many of us would be hitting some of the same lakes, boy was I wrong!!!  Be safe guys!!!
Shore fishing the Ottawa river and the Rideau in the Ottawa area - woot woot!
Hope this forecast changes FAST!!!  Not great fishing weather for August
Lake O out of bronte sat morning.
again got to the trailer and got called back in after about half an hour. not even time for dinner. still here. Damned lightening and rain.

I only wish I had time to fish... working 12 hours tonight ( Friday) , then again Monday and Tuesday.. tomorrow and Sunday I have a long list of things at home... heading east to nova Scotia next weekend! maybe then I can get into some flounder off the wharf or smallmouth bass and pike at my uncles place...
I remember doing that as a kid. 100,s of them off the side of the wharf. Some line a hook and yarn. Hand lined them up.LOL
I remember doing that as a kid. 100,s of them off the side of the wharf. Some line a hook and yarn. Hand lined them up.LOL that brings back memories. that and mackeral off the wharf in august
Leaving Friday.. maybe I might even have a report when I come back...
Back to north channel..it was good to me last weekend..leaving tonight

Well yet another long weekend is upon us, with nothing planned I am going to take a few day trips.  Sunday is Simcoe for smallies, Monday Erie for walleye but I dont know where to go on saturday.  I was thinking sparrow or cuch, I want to do lmb.  Coming from Orangeville I think I will head north on 400.

Pointe au baril for the weekend, Largies tomorrow morning (hehehe start the weekend off early)...pike during the day...and either back to largies for the evening or out for some walleye in the shawanaga river with my dad if hes up for it.  Dock fishing for pike and largies saturday morning and then I will probably take my nephews out in the tinner for largemouth and pike in the evening.  Next weekend though is what I am really excited for, my dad and I are heading to parry sound harbour to run the sunset lakers...staying the night in the boat and trying again at dawn.
Sounds awesome!!!
Might spend Saturday and Sunday on French River chasing some eyes.
Scugog, off the dock, and might try a popper in the pads for large mouth bass.
Elliot Lake Sat and Sunday  for Brookies, pike and bass.  Then to BOQ for Walleye for the rest of the week.  I hope the weather stabilizes.
Same as every weekend...Pigeon  mattp33 if it's lmb you're after, you got some good fishing there in your own back yard.
Just remember to add for few hours to avoid the highway jam ups.
Day trips for me, not sure where, but its gonna be musky, musky, musky  S.
Same as every weekend...Pigeon  mattp33 if it's lmb you're after, you got some good fishing there in your own back yard.  Where are you refering to?
West Arm of Nippissing ...  Bring on the big girls !!!   (The real big ones)

Bancroft area lake tommorow ,then I just randomly pick another 2 lakes it's what I always do !!!! Just get up at 3am and start driving !!!!! It's awesome I just keep fishing different lakes all the time !!!! So many lakes so little time
Temiskaming.   I'm gonna haul arse right after work so I can get out on the water at first light tomorrow morning.
Manitouwabing for 9 days!
West Arm of Nippissing ...  Bring on the big girls !!!   (The real big ones)  See ya Thursday Rich & hoping this is your year for the biggun.

Hmmmmm lets see. Long weekend and live on Simcoe. Bass,perch,lakers,whities,, Yup,thats the plan. You all enjoy the traffic.  Rich and Lew,Have a super safe time up on the Arm. Hope ya both get a bigg,n.
Sounds like BAIT Brian. ......   I'll stop by on my way through and pick them up.  HA HA HA
Anyone want to fish the csfl at scugog with me?  Misfish- we should really hunt for those simcoe smallies together in the fall!
I'm not, but I was up in G Bay for three days last weekend though. Catch up on some work and such this weekend, generally chill right out.

I rarely fish weekends anymore my job allows me to fish weekdays instead which I prefer. So I am going to sit back and have a few cold ones and live vicariously through all of you ... especially the muskie nuts. Traffic should be suicidal with the Skyway being closed around here.

Anyone want to fish the csfl at scugog with me?  Misfish- we should really hunt for those simcoe smallies together in the fall!   Hows this date Matt   Fall Challenge: Orillia – October 4, 2014 Centennial Park, Orillia
Sounds like BAIT Brian. ...... I'll stop by on my way through and pick them up. HA HA HA   Rich,just look for the orange flag on the toon. LOL
Wellers bay, brighton bay and possibly out of belleville
Lake Erie perching for me and the neighbor kids on Saturday - weather permitting.
Sitting behind a control on nights all weekend  My panel is about 50 feet from the Ottawa river, which realllly helps
